component.name: MatrixSelectVector
component.overview:
David Weinstein Michael Callahan
The MatrixSelectVector module allows users to select a single row or column from a matrix. The user can also select a range of rows or columns and send them to the output port one at a time. The MatrixSelectVector module has three input ports: Matrix, Weight Vector and Current Index, which may run concurrently or one at a time.
This module allows the user to animate points on a mesh if computing a whole time series of results packaged within a row or column. As data propogates throughout the image, the Viewer window displays the animation of points on the mesh.

There are several Play Modes in the MatrixSelectVector GUI Dialog >>>>>>> 1.11 window: Once, Loop, Bounce1, and Bounce2. The Once mode plays the animation from current value to the end of the selected range of column and rows on the matrix. The Loop mode playas the selected range endlessly, reversing directions after reaching the start or end of the range. Bounce1 only plays endpoints once, while Bounce2 repeats them. For example, if the range is 1 through 3, Bounce1 will play { 1 2 3 2 1 2 3 2 1 . . .}, while Bounce2 will play {1 2 3 3 2 1 2 3 3 2 1}. Using the Delay text field in the GUI dialog window, the user specifies a delay (in milliseconds)that controls the speed at which the selected rows or columns may be sent to the output port.
